comments:
Trying to run classes or tests, either as application or junit test, I get the
above error.
Tests in some projects work. I have one project that I cannot launch anything
from. Worked just fine in 3.0.1. The error stack is

Error 2005-04-15 14:29:47.946 An internal error occurred during: "Launching".
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at
org.eclipse.jdt.launching.JavaRuntime.processJavaLibraryPathEntries(JavaRuntime.java:1976)
	at
org.eclipse.jdt.launching.JavaRuntime.gatherJavaLibraryPathEntries(JavaRuntime.java:1933)
	at
org.eclipse.jdt.launching.JavaRuntime.gatherJavaLibraryPathEntries(JavaRuntime.java:1943)
	at
org.eclipse.jdt.launching.JavaRuntime.gatherJavaLibraryPathEntries(JavaRuntime.java:1943)
	at
org.eclipse.jdt.launching.JavaRuntime.gatherJavaLibraryPathEntries(JavaRuntime.java:1943)
	at
org.eclipse.jdt.launching.JavaRuntime.computeJavaLibraryPath(JavaRuntime.java:1888)
	at
org.eclipse.jdt.launching.AbstractJavaLaunchConfigurationDelegate.getJavaLibraryPath(AbstractJavaLaunchConfigurationDelegate.java:962)
	at
org.eclipse.jdt.launching.AbstractJavaLaunchConfigurationDelegate.getVMArguments(AbstractJavaLaunchConfigurationDelegate.java:518)
	at org.eclipse.jdt.launching.JavaLaunchDelegate.launch(JavaLaunchDelegate.java:64)
	at
org.eclipse.debug.internal.core.LaunchConfiguration.launch(LaunchConfiguration.java:590)
	at
org.eclipse.debug.internal.core.LaunchConfiguration.launch(LaunchConfiguration.java:515)
	at
org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.DebugUIPlugin.buildAndLaunch(DebugUIPlugin.java:731)
	at org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.DebugUIPlugin$6.run(DebugUIPlugin.java:929)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:67)

eclipse.buildId=I20050401-1645

There are no errors in the problem view or project properties that give a hint
what is going on. It seems to be project specific as some work. I deleted the
launch configuration and tried to re-run, looked at the launch properties for
each that fail, no success. If I find more information about why I'll add it here.

Any number of eclipse -clean, project clean all etc didn't solve this.
I managed to solve it by removing every project, library, jar reference, proving
that my 1 liner launched, then adding them back in one at a time, each time
testing the 1 liner could launch.
The project and classpath both looked ok before, I can't tell what has changed
by this procedure.
Should guard against NPE when resolving container.
